prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three shars:
1. green bell pepper
2. potato
3. eggplant

Now pick out the other shars from the following list:
1. pumpkin
2. bee
3. green bell pepper
4. crane
5. basset hound
6. full-trailer truck
7. Labrador
8. eggplant
9. yellow bell pepper
10. bear
11. loader
12. car
13. box truck
14. school bus
15. carrot
16. red bell pepper
17. onion
18. cat
19. chiller truck
20. Dalmatian
21. seal


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. garbage truck and seal
2. seal and pig
3. seal and basset hound
4. eggplant and red bell pepper
5. carrot and box truck
6. terrier and green bell pepper
7. red bell pepper and bee
8. Labrador and pig
9. motorcycle and eggplant
10. tractor and carrot
11. seal and terrier
12. pumpkin and mutt
13. chiller truck and carrot
14. Labrador and yellow bell pepper
15. bee and basset hound
16. tractor and semi-trailer truck
17. semi-trailer truck and mutt
18. pig and toucan
19. Labrador and crane
20. school bus and green bell pepper
21. garbage truck and pumpkin
22. school bus and toucan
23. motorcycle and Labrador
24. onion and cat
25. semi-trailer truck and school bus
26. seal and cat
27. pumpkin and Labrador
28. garbage truck and loader
29. cat and basset hound
30. tractor and potato
31. bear and loader
32. eggplant and basset hound
33. bee and car
34. basset hound and terrier
35. semi-trailer truck and yellow bell pepper
36. motorcycle and yellow bell pepper
37. bear and car
38. bee and toucan
39. garbage truck and green bell pepper
40. terrier and box truck
41. bear and pig
42. eggplant and semi-trailer truck
43. full-trailer truck and semi-trailer truck
44. basset hound and carrot
45. chiller truck and green bell pepper
46. seal and car
47. potato and yellow bell pepper
48. bear and terrier
49. red bell pepper and pig
50. tractor and yellow bell pepper


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: The objects chosen as 'shars' are vegetables or have vegetable-like properties based on the provided examples (green bell pepper, potato, and eggplant).
